body_html: @ScorpioCPH You should move the fread = tf.read_file('./data.text') line outside the loop. That line is not reading the file...it's just creating an op that will read it when you execute it using sess.run. You just keep re-creating that op in your graph and you end up with 1000 copies of it.
body_text: @ScorpioCPH You should move the fread = tf.read_file('./data.text') line outside the loop. That line is not reading the file...it's just creating an op that will read it when you execute it using sess.run. You just keep re-creating that op in your graph and you end up with 1000 copies of it.
body: @ScorpioCPH You should move the `fread = tf.read_file('./data.text')` line outside the loop. That line is not reading the file...it's just creating an op that will read it when you execute it using `sess.run`. You just keep re-creating that op in your graph and you end up with 1000 copies of it.
